configuration.stem: Explore the images to learn more about how people use wind and water currents.

options.caption: Surfers use knowledge of wind and ocean waves to glide across the water on surf boards.
options.imageAlt: In this photograph, a surfer balances on a surfboard as it moves along an wave rising from the ocean.

options.caption: Hang gliders must understand air currents and how changes in air pressure could affect their flight.
options.imageAlt: In this photograph, a hang glider soars above a beach as wind currents keep the glider airborne.

options.caption: Sailing requires boaters to understand both water and air currents.
options.imageAlt: In this photograph, wind fills the sail of the boat, helping it move along the water.

options.caption: Wind boarders use wind and water currents to travel across the waves.
options.imageAlt: In this photograph, a wind boarder uses both the energy of the ocean wave and the wind to rise above the water.
